Package org.moddingx.libx.datagen.provider

Class BlockStateProviderBase

java.lang.Object
net.minecraftforge.client.model.generators.BlockStateProvider
org.moddingx.libx.datagen.provider.BlockStateProviderBase
All Implemented Interfaces:
net.minecraft.data.DataProvider
public abstract class BlockStateProviderBase extends net.minecraftforge.client.model.generators.BlockStateProvider
A base class for block state and model providers. An extending class should call the manualState and manualModel methods in setup. Another thing you can do is override defaultState and defaultModel to adjust the state and model depending on the block.

    • setup

    • defaultState

      protected void defaultState(net.minecraft.resources.ResourceLocation id, net.minecraft.world.level.block.Block block, Supplier<net.minecraftforge.client.model.generators.ModelFile> model)
      Creates a block state for the given block using the given model. The default implementation checks whether the block has the properties BlockStateProperties.HORIZONTAL_FACING or BlockStateProperties.FACING and creates block states matching those. If you don't use the model, don't call the supplier, so the default model is not generated.

    • defaultModel

      protected net.minecraftforge.client.model.generators.ModelFile defaultModel(net.minecraft.resources.ResourceLocation id, net.minecraft.world.level.block.Block block)
      Creates a model for the given block. The default implementation creates special models for blocks of type LiquidBlock and LeavesBlock.

    • buttonBlock

      public void buttonBlock(net.minecraft.world.level.block.Block block, net.minecraft.resources.ResourceLocation texture)
      Creates a block state and models for a button.
